conclusion: Determine the angle between the emergent light of the red light passing through the prism and the incident light of point M using Snell's law and the properties of the prism.
The incident angle alpha is 60 degrees and the refractive index of the material for red light is n = sqrt(3).
Using Snell's law, calculate the angle of refraction theta_r as 30 degrees.
Determine the angle of incidence on the other side of the prism as 60 degrees.
Using Snell's law for the second medium, calculate the angle of incidence theta_i' as sin^-1(sqrt(3)/6).
Determine the angle of emergence as 180 degrees - sin^-1(sqrt(3)/6).
Calculate the angle between the emergent light and the incident light as 90 degrees.
